Took 5 seconds to nominate HL2:2 for "GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL."
The Game That Deserves A Sequel

This is, and will probably remain, the only review I have written for a game in my Library. This game and its prequels represent some of my earliest moments in PC gaming. I can happily say that the first game I ever played on PC was Half Life 2. That game and its prequels/sequels consumed my early adulthood. I have countless hours in these games on another steam account I used until I owned this one. Even when I transfered over, I still just had to have these games in my library. Even if I had gotten tired of playing them. I can not recommend them enough. Please, Gabe... I need closure. Nominated for "GAME THAT DESERVES A SEQUEL".
Half-Life series are the greatest. Shame what has come of the development cycle for Half-Life 3.
It is good.
I want to believe

Half-Life 2: Episode 2 is a great extrension to the Half Life series and will leave you asking questions and wanting more. If you haven't played the series yet, you really might want to. 

This game includes rich character developement, interesting puzzles, and some pretty intense combat situations. This game has also help up and survived the test of time as far as visuals go, and controls.

Definitely a

Лучшая игра, у которой нету продолжения!

In my restless dreams,
I see that game.

Half-Life 3.

You promised me you'd take me
there again someday.
But you never did.

Well, I'm alone there now...
In our 'special place'...
Waiting for you...

Waiting for you to
come to see me.

But you never do.

And so I wait, wrapped in my
cocoon of pain and loneliness.

I know I've done a terrible
thing to you. Something you'll
never forgive me for.

I wish I could change
that, but I can't.

I feel so pathetic and ugly
laying here, waiting for you...

Every day I stare up at the cracks
in the ceiling and all I can think
about is how unfair it all is...

The doctor came today.
He told me I could go
home for a short stay.

It’s not that I'm getting better.
It’s just that this may be
my last chance...

I think you know what I mean...

Even so, I'm glad to be coming
home. I've missed you terribly.

But I'm afraid, Gabe.
I'm afraid you don't really
want me to come home.

Whenever you come see me,
I can tell how hard it is on you...

I don't know if you
hate me or pity me...
Or maybe I just disgust you...

I'm sorry about that.

When I first learned that
I was going to die, I just
didn't want to accept it.

I was so angry all the time and I
struck out at everyone I loved most.
Especially you, Gabe.

That's why I understand
if you do hate me.

But I want you to
know this, Gabe.

I'll always love you.

Even though our life together had
to end like this, I still wouldn't
trade it for the world. We had
some wonderful years together.

Well, this letter has gone on
too long, so I'll say goodbye.

I told the nurse to give
this to you after I'm gone.

That means that as you read
this, I'm already dead.

I can't tell you to remember me,
but I can't bear for you to
forget me.

These last few years since I
became ill... I'm so sorry for
what I did to you, did to us...

You've given me so much and
I haven't been able to return
a single thing.

That's why I want you to live
for yourself now.
Do what's best for you, Gabe.

Gabe...

You made me happy.

One of the best installments of the Half Life universe to date. I highly recommend playing Every single game previous, starting with the original Half Life, not the source port. If you don't understand the references you didn't play the previous games enough.

That ending though...oh man...
Definitely, this game deserves a sequel more than any other.

This game is absolutely fabulous! If you have played the previous half-life games, you can't just stop, you have to play this one also! If you haven't played the previous half-life games, go play them first, then play this one. Episode 2 has great gameplay along with a lot of replayability. Although it is not my favorite half-life game, it is still one of my favorite games of all time. I cannot recommend it enough!

HL2 Ep2 is still a fantastic shooter that ends in a huge cliffhanger and more than 9 years later we still don't have a sequel.
It's obviously hard to produce something that can top Ep2 (or Portal 2) but leaving players with a big cliffhanger for such a long time ain't nice either. Maybe Valve should let some other company do a sequel if they aren't able or willing to do it themselves. After all this time I don't even want something groundbreaking anymore. Just some decent shootbang in the HL Universe that gives players at least something like an ending to the HL Story. [G-Man died on his way back to his home planet]

That's why I nominated HL2 EP Two for The “Game That Needs A Sequel ASAP” Award
